Hi Jan,

On Mon, Dec 22, 2003 at 07:21:54PM +0100, Jan Algermissen wrote:
> 
> http://lists.xml.org/archives/xml-dev/200207/msg01236.html
> 
> you wrote (concerning using Google's 'link' feature):
> 
> "Tim told me that he thought that http://www.w3.org/Consortium/
>  identified the W3C.  Google suggests that most people who use that
>  URI, do use it this way, so there's an issue there.  But *many* more
>  (roughly, 64000 to 1250) use http://www.w3.org as the W3C's URI."
> 
> How did you 'infer' from Google's result in what way the URI has actually
> been used?

I looked at the context in which "http://www.w3.org" was used.
e.g. here's a use of it;

http://www.opera.com/support/

"Opera closely adheres to the standards issued by the [W3C]"

Obviously I didn't look at all of them, but IIRC, every link I did look at
(probably 10 or so) used it this way.

Mark.
-- 
Mark Baker.   Ottawa, Ontario, CANADA.        http://www.markbaker.ca
